channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CryptoPulse: Short-Term Cryptocurrency Forecasting with Dual-Prediction and Cross-Correlated Market Indicators
item.description: Cryptocurrencies fluctuate in markets with high price volatility, posing significant challenges for investors.

item.title: Poster: Long PHP webshell files detection based on sliding window attention
item.description: In this study, we propose a webshell detection method.

item.title: BatteryLife: A Comprehensive Dataset and Benchmark for Battery Life Prediction
item.description: Notably, BatteryLife is the first to release battery life datasets of zinc-ion batteries, sodium-ion batteries, and industry-tested large-capacity lithium-ion batteries.

item.title: Nexus: A Lightweight and Scalable Multi-Agent Framework for Complex Tasks Automation
item.description: In coding tasks, Nexus-driven MASs achieve a 99% pass rate on HumanEval and a flawless 100% on VerilogEval-Human, outperforming cutting-edge reasoning language models such as o3-mini and DeepSeek-R1.

item.title: Exploring Graph Tasks with Pure LLMs: A Comprehensive Benchmark and Investigation
item.description: In recent years, large language models (LLMs) have emerged as promising candidates for graph tasks, yet most studies focus primarily on performance benchmarks and fail to address their broader potential, including their ability to handle limited data, their transferability across tasks, and their robustness.

item.title: Distill Any Depth: Distillation Creates a Stronger Monocular Depth Estimator
item.description: In this paper, we systematically analyze the impact of different depth normalization strategies on pseudo-label distillation.

item.title: Know You First and Be You Better: Modeling Human-Like User Simulators via Implicit Profiles
item.description: Finally, we adopt a diverse profile sampler to capture the distribution of real-world user profiles.

item.title: AKDT: Adaptive Kernel Dilation Transformer for Effective Image Denoising
item.description: At the core of AKDT, the NE is seamlessly integrated within standard Transformer components to form the Noise-Guided Feed-Forward Network (NG-FFN) and Noise-Guided Multi-Headed Self-Attention (NG-MSA).

item.title: Problem Solved? Information Extraction Design Space for Layout-Rich Documents using LLMs
item.description: This paper defines and explores the design space for information extraction (IE) from layout-rich documents using large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification in Retrieval Augmented Question Answering
item.description: Retrieval augmented Question Answering (QA) helps QA models overcome knowledge gaps by incorporating retrieved evidence, typically a set of passages, alongside the question at test time.

item.title: Harnessing Multiple Large Language Models: A Survey on LLM Ensemble
item.description: LLM Ensemble -- which involves the comprehensive use of multiple large language models (LLMs), each aimed at handling user queries during downstream inference, to benefit from their individual strengths -- has gained substantial attention recently.

item.title: WiCkeD: A Simple Method to Make Multiple Choice Benchmarks More Challenging
item.description: The performance of the models drops 12. 1 points on average with respect to the original versions of the datasets.

item.title: GLEAN: Generalized Category Discovery with Diverse and Quality-Enhanced LLM Feedback
item.description: Generalized Category Discovery (GCD) is a practical and challenging open-world task that aims to recognize both known and novel categories in unlabeled data using limited labeled data from known categories.

item.title: Decoupled Graph Energy-based Model for Node Out-of-Distribution Detection on Heterophilic Graphs
item.description: Despite extensive research efforts focused on OOD detection on images, OOD detection on nodes in graph learning remains underexplored.

item.title: Beyond the convexity assumption: Realistic tabular data generation under quantifier-free real linear constraints
item.description: Synthetic tabular data generation has traditionally been a challenging problem due to the high complexity of the underlying distributions that characterise this type of data.

item.title: AirCast: Improving Air Pollution Forecasting Through Multi-Variable Data Alignment
item.description: In this paper, we introduce AirCast, a novel multi-variable air pollution forecasting model, by combining weather and air quality variables.

item.title: Late Breaking Results: The Art of Beating the Odds with Predictor-Guided Random Design Space Exploration
item.description: This work introduces an innovative method for improving combinational digital circuits through random exploration in MIG-based synthesis.

item.title: Nested Expectations with Kernel Quadrature
item.description: This paper considers the challenging computational task of estimating nested expectations.

item.title: PromptMID: Modal Invariant Descriptors Based on Diffusion and Vision Foundation Models for Optical-SAR Image Matching
item.description: Therefore, effectively leveraging foundation models to improve the generalization of optical-SAR image matching remains challenge.

item.title: FwNet-ECA: Facilitating Window Attention with Global Receptive Fields through Fourier Filtering Operations
item.description: Windowed attention mechanisms were introduced to mitigate the issue of excessive computation inherent in global attention mechanisms.

item.title: Patient Trajectory Prediction: Integrating Clinical Notes with Transformers
item.description: Current models, primarily based on structured data, struggle to capture the complete medical context of patients, resulting in a loss of valuable information.

item.title: Escaping The Big Data Paradigm in Self-Supervised Representation Learning
item.description: We introduce SCOTT (Sparse Convolutional Tokenizer for Transformers), a shallow tokenization architecture that is compatible with Masked Image Modeling (MIM) tasks.

item.title: Training Consistency Models with Variational Noise Coupling
item.description: Consistency Training (CT) has recently emerged as a promising alternative to diffusion models, achieving competitive performance in image generation tasks.

item.title: OmniAlign-V: Towards Enhanced Alignment of MLLMs with Human Preference
item.description: Recent advancements in open-source multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) have primarily focused on enhancing foundational capabilities, leaving a significant gap in human preference alignment.

item.title: VesselSAM: Leveraging SAM for Aortic Vessel Segmentation with LoRA and Atrous Attention
item.description: VesselSAM incorporates AtrousLoRA, a novel module that combines Atrous Attention with Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA), to improve segmentation performance.

item.title: LightFC-X: Lightweight Convolutional Tracker for RGB-X Tracking
item.description: To alleviate this problem, we propose LightFC-X, a family of lightweight convolutional RGB-X trackers that explores a unified convolutional architecture for lightweight multimodal tracking.

item.title: CLIPure: Purification in Latent Space via CLIP for Adversarially Robust Zero-Shot Classification
item.description: We propose two variants for our CLIPure approach: CLIPure-Diff which models the likelihood of images' latent vectors with the DiffusionPrior module in DaLLE-2 (modeling the generation process of CLIP's latent vectors), and CLIPure-Cos which models the likelihood with the cosine similarity between the embeddings of an image and ``a photo of a.''.

item.title: The FFT Strikes Back: An Efficient Alternative to Self-Attention
item.description: Conventional self-attention mechanisms incur quadratic complexity, limiting their scalability on long sequences.

item.title: Optimal Brain Apoptosis
item.description: The increasing complexity and parameter count of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Transformers pose challenges in terms of computational efficiency and resource demands.

item.title: Task Graph Maximum Likelihood Estimation for Procedural Activity Understanding in Egocentric Videos
item.description: We introduce a gradient-based approach for learning task graphs from procedural activities, improving over hand-crafted methods.

item.title: Synthia: Novel Concept Design with Affordance Composition
item.description: Text-to-image (T2I) models enable rapid concept design, making them widely used in AI-driven design.

item.title: ViDoRAG: Visual Document Retrieval-Augmented Generation via Dynamic Iterative Reasoning Agents
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce ViDoSeek, a novel dataset designed to evaluate RAG performance on visually rich documents requiring complex reasoning.

item.title: Detecting Offensive Memes with Social Biases in Singapore Context Using Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Traditional online content moderation systems struggle to classify modern multimodal means of communication, such as memes, a highly nuanced and information-dense medium.

item.title: Neural Network Graph Similarity Computation Based on Graph Fusion
item.description: By merging the node sequences of graph pairs into a single large graph, our method leverages a global attention mechanism to facilitate interaction computations and to harvest cross-graph insights.

item.title: Learning Structure-Supporting Dependencies via Keypoint Interactive Transformer for General Mammal Pose Estimation
item.description: To this end, we propose a Keypoint Interactive Transformer (KIT) to learn instance-level structure-supporting dependencies for general mammal pose estimation.

item.title: Can Multimodal LLMs Perform Time Series Anomaly Detection?
item.description: Starting with the univariate case (point- and range-wise anomalies), we extend our evaluation to more practical scenarios, including multivariate and irregular time series scenarios, and variate-wise anomalies.

item.title: AIR: Complex Instruction Generation via Automatic Iterative Refinement
item.description: With the development of large language models, their ability to follow simple instructions has significantly improved.

item.title: Unveiling the Key Factors for Distilling Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) excel in reasoning tasks through Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting.

item.title: From Vision to Sound: Advancing Audio Anomaly Detection with Vision-Based Algorithms
item.description: Recent advances in Visual Anomaly Detection (VAD) have introduced sophisticated algorithms leveraging embeddings generated by pre-trained feature extractors.

item.title: Near-Optimal Approximations for Bayesian Inference in Function Space
item.description: Exploiting the thus obtained approximate posterior for these $M$ components, we perform inference for $\Pi_{\text{B}}$ by relying on the law of total probability and a sufficiency assumption.

item.title: SpargeAttn: Accurate Sparse Attention Accelerating Any Model Inference
item.description: A universal sparse attention that guarantees both the speedup and end-to-end performance of diverse models remains elusive.

item.title: MRBTP: Efficient Multi-Robot Behavior Tree Planning and Collaboration
item.description: These relevant actions can be pre-planned to form long-horizon subtrees, significantly enhancing the planning speed and collaboration efficiency of MRBTP.

item.title: S-Graphs 2.0 -- A Hierarchical-Semantic Optimization and Loop Closure for SLAM
item.description: Works based on localization and mapping do not exploit the inherent semantic-relational information from the environment for faster and efficient management and optimization of the robot poses and its map elements, often leading to pose and map inaccuracies and computational inefficiencies in large scale environments.

item.title: A Market for Accuracy: Classification under Competition
item.description: We show that our approach benefits the providers as well as the consumers, and find that the timing of market entry and model updates can be crucial.

item.title: MM-PoisonRAG: Disrupting Multimodal RAG with Local and Global Poisoning Attacks
item.description: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) equipped with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) leverage both their rich parametric knowledge and the dynamic, external knowledge to excel in tasks such as Question Answering.

item.title: Controlling dynamics of stochastic systems with deep reinforcement learning
item.description: A properly designed controller can help improve the quality of experimental measurements or force a dynamical system to follow a completely new time-evolution path.

item.title: Learning atomic forces from uncertainty-calibrated adversarial attacks
item.description: By performing geometry optimization for calibrated uncertainty, we reach adversarial structures with the user-assigned target MLIP prediction error.

item.title: Steering Language Model to Stable Speech Emotion Recognition via Contextual Perception and Chain of Thought
item.description: Large-scale audio language models (ALMs), such as Qwen2-Audio, are capable of comprehending diverse audio signal, performing audio analysis and generating textual responses.

item.title: Advantage-Guided Distillation for Preference Alignment in Small Language Models
item.description: Instead of directly applying existing alignment techniques to SLMs, we propose to utilize a well-aligned teacher LLM to guide the alignment process for these models, thereby facilitating the transfer of the teacher's knowledge of human preferences to the student model.

item.title: CaseGen: A Benchmark for Multi-Stage Legal Case Documents Generation
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, CaseGen is the first benchmark designed to evaluate LLMs in the context of legal case document generation.
